utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Smell that? That’s the smell of new comic books. Oh, yes!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They’re on me today, boys.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re paying? Have you been selling your sperm again?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I’m celebrating. As we speak, the space shuttle is docking at the International Space Station where it will deploy the Wolowitz Zero-Gravity Waste Disposal System.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, get over yourself, it’s a high-tech toilet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just think. Thanks to your hard work, an international crew of astronauts will boldly go

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is that supposed to be funny?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I believe it is. The combination of the Star Trek reference and the play on words involving the double-meaning of the verb to go suggests that Leonard is humorously mocking your efforts in space plumbing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, make your little jokes, but of the four of us, I’m the only one making any real-world contribution to science and technology.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s right. This is an important achievement, for two reasons. Number one, and, of course, number two.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, clever! Playing on the use of cardinal numbers as euphemisms for bodily functions.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Here, Sheldon, I pulled the new Hellboy for you. It’s mind-blowing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, spoiler alert.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I didn’t spoil anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You told me it’s mind-blowing, so, my mind is going into it pre-blown. And once a mind is pre-blown, it cannot be re-blown.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Said the Grinch to Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, hey, Leonard, can I talk to you about something?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, sure, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Remember I went out with your friend Penny a couple weeks ago?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, vaguely.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure you remember. You went to the bar and made a fool of yourself trying to pick up strange women.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about it?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, uh, the thing is, the date didn’t go that well.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, too bad. I guess the thing to do now is just pick yourself up, dust yourself off, forget it and move on.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why the hell not?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: ‘Cause we’re going out again tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, Stuart. Have you read the new Flash?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I have and it will knock your socks off! Good luck getting them back on.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, anyway, I figured this is probably my last shot with Penny and I don’t want to screw it up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nobody wants that.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So, here’s my question. It’s the second date, you think she’ll be expecting things to get physical?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, oh, gee, my initial reaction is no. You know, let me think about it and get back to you, okay?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, so, you’ll give me a call?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, or you call me.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Or nobody calls anyone.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Interesting. Penny’s current suitor asking advice from her former suitor.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, thanks for closed-captioning my pain, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, wanna make sure he gets nowhere with Penny without jeopardizing your friendship with either of them?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m listening.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just tell him to do everything you’ve done with her for the last two years.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good, good. You?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine. Oh, hey, can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know your friend Stuart?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, he asked me out again and I said yes, and then I started thinking maybe I should talk to you first.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, does it bother you, me going out with one of your friends? ‘Cause you know, you and me…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no that’s the past. I’m really more of a right now kind of guy. You know, living in the moment. Although I do have to live a little in the future, ’cause, well, that’s my job. Of course, my fondness for classic science fiction does draw my attention backwards, but those stories often take place in the future. In conclusion, no, it doesn’t bother me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, that’s really cool of you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, well I wouldn’t say cool, I’d just say, that’s Leonard!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, In that case, do you mind giving me some advice?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: About Stuart? Love to.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He’s very shy, how do I make him feel more comfortable around me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, uh, first of all, don’t underestimate the value of discomfort.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, yeah, Stuart thrives under pressure, that’s why he works in a comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. It’s Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re not going to answer it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He wants to talk about Penny. I don’t want to talk about Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re making an assumption. Perhaps the comic book store is on fire, and he needs your assistance.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would he call me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We don’t know. And if you don’t answer the phone, we can’t know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not answering the phone, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Answer the phone, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No! There, it went to voice mail.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aren’t you going to check your messages?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You have to check your messages, the leaving of a message is one half of a social contract which is completed by the checking of the message. If that contract breaks down then all social contracts break down and we descend into anarchy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It must be hell inside your head.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: At times.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Guys, we have a code red.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you mean code red the hospital emergency alert, code red the computer worm, or code red the cherry flavoured soft drink from the makers of Mountain Dew?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, I was going over the schematics on my zero-G toilet, and I made a teeny tiny mistake on the specifications for the diverter valve.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How teeny tiny?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s gonna fail after about ten flushes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But the mission is for six months.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, see, that’s the code red. It’s kind of like a jack-in-the-box, no one knows exactly when, but at some point something way worse than a puppet is gonna pop out of that box.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Have you notified NASA?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Are you crazy?What am I gonna say? I screwed up your toilet and pretty soon there’s gonna be crap floating all over your nice shiny space station?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, what are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m gonna figure out how to fix it, then I’ll tell them.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, what do you need us for?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He can’t figure out how to fix it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, you said you were gonna be supportive.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m trying, but you have to admit this is pretty damn funny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I agree. It’s the juxtaposition of the high-tech nature of space exploration against the banality of a malfunctioning toilet that provides the comic fodder here. Check your messages.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, this is an exact duplicate of the Wolowitz Zero-Gravity Human Waste Disposal System as deployed on the International Space Station.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t you mean the Wolowitz Zero-Gravity Human Waste Distribution System?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, ha, it’s hilarious. Now, here’s an approximation of the spare parts available on the Space Station. We gotta find a way, using nothing but this, to reinforce this so the waste material avoids the spinning turbine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You mean so it doesn’t hit the fan?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I have to say, I thought the toilet humour would get less funny with repetition. Apparently, there is no law of diminishing comedic returns with space poop.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You busy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Classified, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a regular Manhattan Project. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, tonight’s my date with Penny and since we haven’t been able to connect by phone…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sorry, it’s been broken.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Or e-mail.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, that too. Everything’s broken.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Anyway, I was just wondering if you had any last-minute advice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, well, off the top of my head, I think the most important thing with Penny is to go really slow. I mean, glacial.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, guys come onto her all the time, so, you need to, like, set yourself apart. You know, be a little shy, don’t make too much eye contact. And, you know, treat her with, like, cool detachment and, and, and, you know, fear.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Fear?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, like, you’re afraid that if you touch her, she’ll break.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, that plays right into my wheelhouse.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good, good. Well, you kids have fun tonight.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Thanks, Leonard. What is that thing anyway?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You don’t know what this is?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good. Get out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Be afraid of Penny, nice, very crafty.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It wasn’t bad advice. It just wasn’t particularly helpful.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For what it’s worth, my mother says that when we deceive for personal gain, we make Jesus cry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, what if we use this two-inch PVC to reinforce the centre cross-support?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No good. I mean, it might work for the Japanese and the Americans, but have you seen the size of the Russians they got up there? This thing has to hold up against a hearty potato-based diet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I feel terrible.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe if you were helping, you’d feel better about yourself.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I deliberately tried to sabotage Stuart’s date with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of course you feel terrible. You completely screwed up your karma, dude.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t really believe in that superstition, do you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s not superstition. It’s practically Newtonian. For every action, there’s an equal and opposite reaction. Leonard pretends to be a friend and acts like a two-faced bitch, therefore, he is reborn as a banana slug. It’s actually a very elegant system, you know, what goes around comes around.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Speaking of what goes around comes around…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, look. Instead of trying to reinforce this structure here, what if we just ran another line, bypass it entirely?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It won’t work. The diameter of the tubing is insufficient.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What if we reposition the collection tank?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It won’t work. No way to mount it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, here’s an idea. What if I change my name and go live with my cousin and her husband Avi in Israel?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That could work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Morning. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nothing. We just pulled an all-nighter trying to fix a zero-gravity… pasta maker. I’m gonna make a coffee run. Do you want any?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, thanks. I have coffee.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. So how’d it go with Stuart last night?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I really don’t want to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. Right. Sure. The thing is, before you guys went out, I spoke to him and…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I said I don’t want to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay… I just… I kind of…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, Leonard, what goes on between me and Stuart is none of your business. So just leave it alone, okay?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you really want to clean up your karma, go get my freakin’ latte.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on, I think I’ve got this. Help me see if we can wedge this little piece of PVC behind the support rod.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re overestimating the tensile strength of the substructure you’re building.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I know what I’m doing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you knew what you were doing, there wouldn’t be a space toilet where my coffee table should be.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard, wait. Why don’t you use this instead of the PVC to keep the transverse filter assembly in place?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Because this is not a spare part from the space station. This is the thing from the pizza box that keeps the lid from touching the cheese.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That what that’s for? In India, the lid just touches the cheese. Of course, we also have rampant poverty and periodic outbreaks of cholera, so a little cardboard in our cheese is no biggie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, an excellent idea! I could certainly use a break.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hold on, you can go to the comic book store when man can once again safely poop in space.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why does Leonard get to go?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: ‘Cause he’s upset over his situation with Penny and if I have to hear about it again, I’m going to kick him in his ovaries.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks for understanding, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I got your back, sister. All right, I think we’ve got a prototype ready to test. Hand me that Tupperware.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow, that’s heavy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Damn right it’s heavy, it’s my mother’s meat loaf, it’s been testing toilets for generations.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I must say, Howard, I think a detailed letter to MIT describing your current circumstances might entitle you to a refund on your master’s degree.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, simulated zero-gravity human waste disposal test with meat loaf analog in three, two, one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do you think the problem is?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not enough bread crumbs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Stuart, I need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Sure, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think I gave you bad advice about Penny, and I want to apologize.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No, your advice was great.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It was?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, going slow really worked.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding. Never worked for me.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, last night at dinner, I did what you told me, I went really slow, I kept my distance, and two bottles of wine later, we were making out in my car.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wine? I didn’t say to give her wine.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter, that’s where it all went to hell.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: During the kissing? What did you do, sneeze in her mouth? I did that to a girl once.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No, everything was good and really hot, and I said “Oh, Penny,” and right where she was supposed to say, “Oh, Stuart,” she said… your name.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: That is your name, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, no, yeah, wow, I’m sorry. That must’ve been the last thing you wanted to hear.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, it beats you know I’m a dude, right? Yeah, it was pretty bad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No doubt, no doubt. Okay, well, I’m sorry it didn’t work out.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Not your fault.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, how about that? See you soon.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, sir, I understand classified. We’ll keep it all classified, no one has to know but you and me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s classified?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard’s space toilet. I’ll tell you later.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, they’ve deployed our solution. Let’s just all hope it works.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t see why I have to worry. My career’s not hanging in the balance. That was a joke. It’s funny, because it’s true.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, could you pass the soy sauce, please?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, were you talking to me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I said Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, you did, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Meatloaf.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What was it doing on the ceiling?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s classified.

utterance.speaker: Voice
utterance.content: Houston, International Space Station. We have a little situation up here. We’d like to make an unscheduled space walk.

utterance.speaker: Houston
utterance.content: ISS, Houston. Which crew members would be involved in this E.V.A.?

utterance.speaker: ISS voice
utterance.content: Houston, we’d all like to step outside for a few minutes.

utterance.speaker: Houston
utterance.content: ISS, I’m afraid we can’t authorize that.

utterance.speaker: ISS voice
utterance.content: Uh, Houston, this is more of an FYI call. We are basically out the door.
